intro: Dianthus serotinus, commonly known as late flowering carnation, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer to autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers consist of two rows of petals, with the outer petals being larger and more prominent. Dianthus serotinus is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats, and it thrives in well-drained soils.
